intro: Dyschoriste multicaulis, commonly known as the clustered dyschoriste, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its erect or decumbent stems and opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and typically have five petals. Dyschoriste multicaulis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories or along riverbanks.
